result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose R Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work, treatment, and schooling.
Consecutive to: any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessment supervision and DNA fees during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

Obtain high school diploma/GED/HSED. If defendant is working on his education the Court will waive the employment and community service.
Maintain full time/part time employment or schooling.

Electronic monitoring.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Random urines screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, drug dealing.
Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.
Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programs deemed appropriate by the agent.
Court will consider expungement if defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding, and at the conclusion of his term of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose R Gonzalez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel.

Defendant sentenced to serve 135 DAYS in the House of Correction / Day Reporting Center, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work, treatment, and schooling. 

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS with the following conditions as to probation:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessment supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Electronic monitoring.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.
*  Obtain high school diploma /GED / HSED.   If Defendant is working on his education the Court will waive the employment and community service.
*  Community service of 20 hours.
*  Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programs deemed appropriate by the agent.

Court will consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding, and at the conclusion of his term of probation.

Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Jose R Gonzalez in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter:  Ishmael Maldonado. On motion of the State Court AMENDED Count 1 from Possession w/Intent-Heroin (Felony)  TO Possession of Cocaine under Wisconsin Stats. 961.41(3g)(c) a Class U Misdemeanor. Parties are prepared to proceed with a Projected Guilty Plea.

Defendant Jose R Gonzalez in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-11-2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Jose R Gonzalez in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 26.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Jose R Gonzalez in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Jose R Gonzalez in custody.  Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
